b3Quaternion Class Reference

The b3Quaternion implements quaternion to perform linear algebra rotations in combination with b3Matrix3x3, b3Vector3 and b3Transform. More...

#include <b3Quaternion.h>

 Return the quaternion which is the result of Spherical Linear Interpolation between this and the other quaternion.

Detailed Description

The b3Quaternion implements quaternion to perform linear algebra rotations in combination with b3Matrix3x3, b3Vector3 and b3Transform.

Definition at line 42 of file b3Quaternion.h.

Here is the call graph for this function:

b3Quaternion b3Quaternion::slerp ( const b3Quaternion &  q,
const b3Scalar &  t 
) const [inline]

Return the quaternion which is the result of Spherical Linear Interpolation between this and the other quaternion.

Parameters:
q The other quaternion to interpolate with
t The ratio between this and q to interpolate. If t = 0 the result is this, if t=1 the result is q. Slerp interpolates assuming constant velocity.

00522         {
00523           b3Scalar magnitude = b3Sqrt(length2() * q.length2()); 
00524           b3Assert(magnitude > b3Scalar(0));
00525 
00526     b3Scalar product = dot(q) / magnitude;
00527     if (b3Fabs(product) < b3Scalar(1))
00528                 {
00529       // Take care of long angle case see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slerp
00530       const b3Scalar sign = (product < 0) ? b3Scalar(-1) : b3Scalar(1);
00531 
00532       const b3Scalar theta = b3Acos(sign * product);
00533       const b3Scalar s1 = b3Sin(sign * t * theta);   
00534       const b3Scalar d = b3Scalar(1.0) / b3Sin(theta);
00535       const b3Scalar s0 = b3Sin((b3Scalar(1.0) - t) * theta);
00536 
00537       return b3Quaternion(
00538           (m_floats[0] * s0 + q.getX() * s1) * d,
00539           (m_floats[1] * s0 + q.getY() * s1) * d,
00540           (m_floats[2] * s0 + q.getZ() * s1) * d,
00541           (m_floats[3] * s0 + q.m_floats[3] * s1) * d);
00542                 }

00545                         return *this;
